## Mole Balance in General

 ${\dot{n}_{k+1}}^1 + {\dot{n}_{k-1}}^2 = {\dot{n}_{k}}^1 + {\dot{n}_{k}}^2 = \dot{n}_{tot}$ 

 ${\dot{x}_i}{\dot{n}_{k+1}}^1 + {\dot{y}_i}{\dot{n}_{k-1}}^2 = {\dot{x}_i}{\dot{n}_{k}}^1 + {\dot{y}_i}{\dot{n}_{k}}^2$ $

 $z_{i,k} = \dfrac{{\dot{x}_i}{\dot{n}_{k+1}}^1 + {\dot{y}_i}{\dot{n}_{k-1}}^2}{{\dot{n}_{k+1}}^1 + {\dot{n}_{k-1}}^2} = \dfrac{{\dot{x}_i}{\dot{n}_{k}}^1 + {\dot{y}_i}{\dot{n}_{k}}^2}{{\dot{n}_{k}}^1 + {\dot{n}_{k}}^2}$ 

 $\dfrac{\dot{n}_{k}^1}{{\dot{n}_{k}}} = \dfrac{\dot{n}_{k}^1}{\dot{n}_{k}^1 + \dot{n}_{k}^2}$ $\hspace{5mm}$ $\dfrac{\dot{n}_{k}^2}{{\dot{n}_{k k}}} = \dfrac{\dot{n}_{k}^2}{\dot{n}_{k}^1 + \dot{n}_{k}^2}$

## The Lever Rule for Phase Diagrams

 1. If </br> $n_o = n_α + n_β$

 2. Then </br> $n_α l_1 = n_β l_2$ </br> $\dfrac{n_α}{n_o} = \dfrac{l_2}{l_3}$ </br> $\dfrac{n_β}{n_o} = \dfrac{l_1}{l_3}$

 {image}

## For binary VLE mixtures, five types of calculations are usually performed:

 1. BUBL P – Given all $x_i$’s and T, calculate P at which the first
bubble forms, and $y_i$’s of the bubble.
 2. BUBL T – Given all $x_i$’s and P, calculate T at which the first
bubble forms, and $y_i$’s of the bubble.
 3. DEW P – Given all $y_i$’s and T, calculate P at which the first
droplet condenses, and $x_i$’s of the droplet.
 4. DEW T – Given all $y_i$’s and P, calculate T at which the first
droplet condenses, and $x_i$’s of the droplet.
 5. FLASH – Given overall composition ($z_i$’s) and T and P, calculate
$x_i$’s and $y_i$’s, and relative amounts of vapor, V, and liquid, L.
